question: Which Beatles album is often considered their masterpiece?
A: Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band
funFact: Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band was released in 1967 and is widely regarded as one of the greatest albums of all time.

question: Which Rolling Stones album features the song 'Paint It Black'?
funFact: Aftermath by The Rolling Stones was released in 1966 and featured Paint It Black as a single.

question: Which Beatles song was their first number one hit in the US?
A: I Want to Hold Your Hand
funFact: I Want to Hold Your Hand by The Beatles was released in 1963 and became their first number one hit in the US in 1964.

question: Which Rolling Stones song features the opening line 'I can't get no satisfaction'?
funFact: (I Can't Get No) Satisfaction by The Rolling Stones was released in 1965 and became one of their most iconic songs.

question: Which Beatles album was their last studio album?
D: Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band
funFact: Abbey Road by The Beatles was released in 1969 and was their last studio album recorded together, though Let It Be was released later.

question: Which Rolling Stones album features the song 'Gimme Shelter'?
funFact: Let It Bleed by The Rolling Stones was released in 1969 and featured Gimme Shelter as the opening track.

question: Which Beatles song features the line 'All you need is love'?
funFact: All You Need Is Love by The Beatles was released in 1967 and was performed live via satellite for the first global television broadcast.

question: Which Rolling Stones song features the line 'Please allow me to introduce myself'?
funFact: Sympathy for the Devil by The Rolling Stones was released in 1968 and features Mick Jagger as the narrator from the devil's perspective.

question: Which Beatles song is the most covered song in history?
funFact: Yesterday by The Beatles has been covered by over 2,200 artists, making it the most covered song in history.

question: Which Rolling Stones album features the song 'Brown Sugar'?
funFact: Sticky Fingers by The Rolling Stones was released in 1971 and featured Brown Sugar as the lead single.

question: Which Beatles song features the line 'Hey Jude, don't be afraid'?
funFact: Hey Jude by The Beatles was released in 1968 and became their longest number one hit at over 7 minutes.

question: Which Rolling Stones song features the line 'It's only rock and roll but I like it'?
A: It's Only Rock 'n Roll (But I Like It)
funFact: It's Only Rock 'n Roll (But I Like It) by The Rolling Stones was released in 1974 and became a signature song.

question: Which Beatles song features the line 'Let it be, let it be'?
funFact: Let It Be by The Beatles was released in 1970 and was inspired by a dream Paul McCartney had about his mother.

question: Which Rolling Stones album features the song 'Start Me Up'?
funFact: Tattoo You by The Rolling Stones was released in 1981 and featured Start Me Up as the lead single.

question: Which Beatles song features the line 'She loves you, yeah, yeah, yeah'?
B: I Want to Hold Your Hand
funFact: She Loves You by The Beatles was released in 1963 and became one of their early hits in the UK.

question: Which Rolling Stones song features the line 'Jumpin' Jack Flash, it's a gas, gas, gas'?
funFact: Jumpin' Jack Flash by The Rolling Stones was released in 1968 and became one of their most popular songs.

question: Which Beatles album is also known as 'The White Album'?
C: Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band
funFact: The Beatles (1968) is commonly known as The White Album due to its plain white cover design.

question: Which Rolling Stones album features the song 'Wild Horses'?
funFact: Sticky Fingers by The Rolling Stones was released in 1971 and featured Wild Horses as a ballad.

question: Which Beatles song features the line 'I am the walrus'?
C: Lucy in the Sky with Diamonds
funFact: I Am the Walrus by The Beatles was released in 1967 and was written by John Lennon with surreal lyrics.

question: Which Rolling Stones album features the song 'Angie'?
funFact: Goats Head Soup by The Rolling Stones was released in 1973 and featured Angie as a ballad.

question: Which Beatles song features the line 'Lucy in the sky with diamonds'?
A: Lucy in the Sky with Diamonds
funFact: Lucy in the Sky with Diamonds by The Beatles was released in 1967 and was inspired by a drawing by John Lennon's son.

question: Which Rolling Stones album features the song 'You Can't Always Get What You Want'?
funFact: Let It Bleed by The Rolling Stones was released in 1969 and featured You Can't Always Get What You Want as the closing track.

question: Which Beatles song features the line 'Strawberry fields forever'?
B: Lucy in the Sky with Diamonds
funFact: Strawberry Fields Forever by The Beatles was released in 1967 and was inspired by a Salvation Army children's home in Liverpool.

question: Which Rolling Stones album features the song 'Honky Tonk Women'?
A: Through the Past, Darkly (Big Hits Vol. 2)
funFact: Honky Tonk Women by The Rolling Stones was released as a single in 1969 and became a number one hit.

question: Which Beatles song features the line 'A day in the life'?
C: Lucy in the Sky with Diamonds
funFact: A Day in the Life by The Beatles was released in 1967 and features a famous orchestral crescendo.

question: Which Rolling Stones album features the song 'Tumbling Dice'?
funFact: Exile on Main St. by The Rolling Stones was released in 1972 and featured Tumbling Dice as a single.

question: Which Beatles song features the line 'Here comes the sun'?
funFact: Here Comes the Sun by The Beatles was released in 1969 and was written by George Harrison.

question: Which Rolling Stones album features the song 'Miss You'?
funFact: Some Girls by The Rolling Stones was released in 1978 and featured Miss You as a disco-influenced single.

question: Which Beatles song features the line 'Something in the way she moves'?
funFact: Something by The Beatles was released in 1969 and was written by George Harrison, becoming one of his most famous compositions.

question: Which Rolling Stones album features the song 'Beast of Burden'?
funFact: Some Girls by The Rolling Stones was released in 1978 and featured Beast of Burden as a ballad.

question: Which Beatles song features the line 'Come together, right now, over me'?
funFact: Come Together by The Beatles was released in 1969 and was written by John Lennon as a campaign song for Timothy Leary.

question: Which Rolling Stones album features the song 'Ruby Tuesday'?
funFact: Ruby Tuesday by The Rolling Stones was released as a single in 1967 and became a number one hit.
